newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat ends higher on corn spillover.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat ends higher on corn spillover.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures settled higher after a thinly traded session in which CBOT corn futures pulled the grains complex higher, traders said.
Corn rallied as forecasts for hot, dry weather in key growing areas of the U.S. Midwest raised concerns of possible damage to the crop.
"We just followed corn all day," a MGE floor source said.
Traders said MGE spring wheat saw some minor pressure after USDA said Monday that 50 percent of the crop was in good to excellent condition, up from the previous week's rating of 48 percent.
MGE spring wheat settled two to nine cents per bushel higher, with new crop September up four cents at $3.70-3/4.
Traders said Benson-Quinn bought one million Sept bushels and Atwood-Peavey bought 800,000 Sept. Prudential sold 800,000 Dec bushels and bull-spread 400,000 Sept/Dec bushels at four cents.
MGE spring wheat futures volume was estimated at 14.92 million bushels, down from 16.28 million Monday.
